article: From the very first moment I met Mattie on my TV show three years ago, I fell in love with him. He was a ten-year-old little _ born with a life-threatening disease. But his poems of peace and _ had touched millions of lives. We became quick friends, _ each other. We often talked about the sunrises and sunsets on the web, and I _ with Mattie that being a black, I wasn't a beach person because there was no _ for me to tan. He strongly _ me to go to the beach that he and his mom visited. He always _ every single second of the present. He could not understand why everybody wasn't out on the beach at _ during their vacation, and he couldn't _ why people would want to miss a _ . I said, Mattie, most people don't like to _ early on vacation. We also talked a lot about _ . He said to me one day, I sometimes get a little unhappy or angry when I'm _ of dying. The boys who lived upstairs said that _ I got famous, I should always be happy and never sad. I don't _ they understand what it's like to know you have to live your life so _ , because unless I keep getting miracles, my life here won't _ . I am afraid of the pain of dying and worried about what I will _ because I love living so, so, so much. After a pause, he continued, I really do want to be a _ when I die. My dream is to bring my _ of peace to as many people as possible.
